review_id: Went in for the first time.... service was awesome and friendly.... you like coffee this is a great place to get it

review_id: The friendliest staff known to man. The muffins are insane if you haven't had their carrot & coconut muffin then stop what you're doing and go now. On top of the great food and coffee they are always so patient with my jumpy puppy and they always give him a tiny little treat.

review_id: Great coffee in the Parkdale neighbourhood. You will find plenty of locals coming here for a lovely cup of their favorite espresso based drink. This is a sizeable place with enough seating to come and work for an afternoon, read with some relaxing music, or catch up with a friend.

review_id: I got a Flat white which's nice! Little cutie cups, cozy atmosphere, and the barista is kind. I will be back again. I want to try their muffins next time!!!

review_id: Perfect place to have coffee or tea or other drinks, with the perfect environment. The coffee and cappuccino was like I've never had anywhere before and it's made me quit going to Starbucks. The staff is very kind and extraordinary.

review_id: Clean environment, good snack selection, and strong wifi. Perfect place to do work. Though just a little cold. Would give a 4 but felt this place is underrated.

review_id:
Cute little hidden gem.
Super friendly barista, cozy space, good food and coffee.
Can't wait to visit during summer.
review_text:
Cute little hidden gem.
Super friendly barista, cozy space, good food and coffee.
Can't wait to visit during summer.

review_id:
GREAT drinks and food here! It's an underrated little gem on King, which is super close to work, so it's my go-to for my morning and afternoon pick-me-up when I'm at the office.
DO try the ham & cheese croissant and get it warmed up ! It is divine! I've also had their spinach, chocolate, and plain croissants and they're all great. Their oatmeal cookie is also delicious. The only thing I haven't liked food-wise was their roasted red pepper quiche. I found it quite bland and a little soggy.
Their coffee is really yummy, but they can also make a dope oat or coconut or chai latte.
review_text:

review_id:
Enjoyed very much!

I ordered a medium quad Americano and a croissant sandwich. The Americano was amazing! Creamy and smooth.

The sandwich was also very good!

Service was very nice and helpful.

review_id: I come here at least once per week and they have an extremely friendly and talented staff, great coffee, and an awesome selection of delicious baked goods. What more can you want out of a neighbourhood cafe? Definitely a favourite. 10/10 recommend.
review_text: I come here at least once per week and they have an extremely friendly and talented staff, great coffee, and an awesome selection of delicious baked goods. What more can you want out of a neighbourhood cafe? Definitely a favourite. 10/10 recommend.

review_id:
Absolutely love them. Everyone at Louie is a kind hearted soul, really nice people. Their coffee is definitely the best in LV. I'm not an espresso person but my friends love their espresso. I also really like their sandwiches; turkey brie is my favorite. Their freedom jars are also very good. They also support independent artists it seems and they have books to purchase on discounted prices.

Basically everything about this place is excellent.

review_id: Breakfast burrito & traditional breakfast really hit the spot for fast & delicious food on our way out of town. Very friendly!
review_text: Breakfast burrito & traditional breakfast really hit the spot for fast & delicious food on our way out of town. Very friendly!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for supporting local businesses we are happy that you came and visit please chat with us or visit our website we have some promotions going thank you

review_id: Best breakfast find in Santa Fe! The food, service, and prices are on point! Do yourself a favor and drink the El Salvador coffee. The side of fruit was a beautiful mix of perfectly ripe fruit. The green chili is all you could desire, flavorful, the right heat, and generous.
review_text: Best breakfast find in Santa Fe! The food, service, and prices are on point! Do yourself a favor and drink the El Salvador coffee. The side of fruit was a beautiful mix of perfectly ripe fruit. The green chili is all you could desire, flavorful, the right heat, and generous.

review_id: Great place with quality food and coffee! Service was wonderful too. I recommend smothered chorizo burrito
review_text: Great place with quality food and coffee! Service was wonderful too. I recommend smothered chorizo burrito

review_id: Food was absolutely fantastic! Servers were fast and attentive, and the overall atmosphere was great. We almost overlooked this place, and I'm so glad we didnt! We ordered a savory ham crepe and a chorizo breakfast burritos.
review_text: Food was absolutely fantastic! Servers were fast and attentive, and the overall atmosphere was great. We almost overlooked this place, and I'm so glad we didnt! We ordered a savory ham crepe and a chorizo breakfast burritos.

review_id: Ordered the Nutella & banana crepes, banana crepe, Pancake breakfast, and the bacon omelette with a mango smoothie. Food and service was good. The crepes were my 3 kids favorite hands down. Oldest said, It tasted like I was eating straight out of Ratatouille." Our waiter took our order and brought the food out. We were most impressed with him balancing 4 plates on one arm.

review_id: Everything I have eaten here has been fantastic from their bagels to burritos, lattes (chai and espresso) to smoothies. Everyone was incredibly friendly and seem to really enjoy their jobs. I also enjoyed the guitar player Sunday morning. It was a great place to get some work done while enjoying fantastic food.
review_text: Everything I have eaten here has been fantastic from their bagels to burritos, lattes (chai and espresso) to smoothies. Everyone was incredibly friendly and seem to really enjoy their jobs. I also enjoyed the guitar player Sunday morning. It was a great place to get some work done while enjoying fantastic food.

review_id: Sagche's is our go-to breakfast spot in Santa Fe. We come here every time we drive down from our home in Taos. Order at the counter. The owner is always there and he's so welcoming. We love supporting his small business and we're happy to see he's expanding his space. Great veggie breakfast burritos with spinach, mushrooms and zucchini. Excellent bacon breakfast burritos too. The Guatemalan breakfast is another good option.
review_text: Sagche's is our go-to breakfast spot in Santa Fe. We come here every time we drive down from our home in Taos. Order at the counter. The owner is always there and he's so welcoming. We love supporting his small business and we're happy to see he's expanding his space. Great veggie breakfast burritos with spinach, mushrooms and zucchini. Excellent bacon breakfast burritos too. The Guatemalan breakfast is another good option.

review_id:
My favorite place to eat in Santa Fe,
Still wanna ask for the Guatemalan traditional breakfast as a burrito but haven't asked yet, everything is good here... They're also expanding & will have a larger dining area soon, I have Celiac (can't eat gluten) and haven't had issues yet. It that doesn't mean it's safe for everyone, but it's been fine for me.

I wish they had a menu that specified gluten free, vegan & vegetarian options that would be helpful.

I hope they only get better, tbh, cuz their food is awesome.

review_id:
Road tripping with my fam and hit up a couple coffee shops along the way.  Cute little shop but not my favorite.  Ordered a caramel macchiato and got a caramel latte instead.  To be fair the man behind the counter offered to remake but I don't like waste.  I think the macchiato would have been better but it was very weak and tasted watered down to me. I also picked up vanilla scones. They tasted good but I believe they had been recently frozen because they were cold and hard. He did ask if I wanted them heated and I said no but didn't know they were half frozen. I will say that I have had scones from Tibet coffee shops in the area are they were not true scones.  These had a good biscuity texture like a scone should and wasn't just a triangle muffin.  After googling I realized this is a chain and not sure if it's locally owned.
There are two different t cups in the photo because we also stopped at another shop.

review_id: This is a really cute little coffee shop! I've staycationed in Fort Collins a few times and walked right by this place. Today, I decided to give it a shot. I ordered a small Butter Baby with oat milk and it was so yummy! They have a great selection of coffees, drinks and snacks and a very welcoming atmosphere. And the barista gal, Vickie is super nice! I will definitely visit here again!

review_id: Great spot for coffee and working quietly at a table. Wide selection of specialty drinks which all seem super  . They offer free dog treats for pet owners!

review_id: Friendly staff, open earliest at 6 am if you're an early riser.

review_id: Out of all the coffee places in Fort Collins this one is my favorite. The people are always friendly, the music is good, and the coffee is great 95% of the time. The other coffee houses/drive-thru stands often burn my espresso.
review_text: Out of all the coffee places in Fort Collins this one is my favorite. The people are always friendly, the music is good, and the coffee is great 95% of the time. The other coffee houses/drive-thru stands often burn my espresso.

review_id:
I was walking along Queen Street and wondering where I would have my coffee since several of my beloved coffee places went belly up when I came across Atlantis Coffee.
It didn't look much from the outside. The two small tables on the patio implied (in my head) that the inside was small and probably crowded... then I entered the space, and a smile exploded across my face. One of the most refined and spacious steampunk-style avenues welcomed me inside. Behind the counter was a handsome and friendly bartender who greeted me kindly. Without further ado, the place was fantastic! The raspberry croissant I ordered was out of this world (not to eat often, though ;) since calorically it was a tiny bomb).
This place will be one of my favourite places on Queen.
review_text:
I was walking along Queen Street and wondering where I would have my coffee since several of my beloved coffee places went belly up when I came across Atlantis Coffee.
It didn't look much from the outside. review_id: As a partner of a barrister, I tried lots of good coffee around the world, and I have to say this is so far the best coffee I had in Toronto. The Ethiopia bean is amazing in both hot and ice latte. Fruity, citrus, strawberry. It brings all the sweetness from the milk makes a perfect balance. The Brazil bean is showing all what you expect, peanut, vanilla. Croissant is amazing. Also tried their drip couple weeks ago, never expect a drip can brings you tasting notes. The owner is super friendly, definitely worth every penny spent. Amazing place!
review_text: As a partner of a barrister, I tried lots of good coffee around the world, and I have to say this is so far the best coffee I had in Toronto. The Brazil bean is showing all what you expect, peanut, vanilla. Croissant is amazing. Also tried their drip couple weeks ago, never expect a drip can brings you tasting notes. The owner is super friendly, definitely worth every penny spent. Amazing place!

review_id: We travel from Rhode Island to visit Toronto and this coffee shop was our first stop. Great coffee! Nice environment!! Will come again.

review_id: Discovered this place just recently. I usually walk the other direction to Larry's or Capital but this place is a huge upgrade. The coffee is high quality and the bakery is top notch. The internal decor is intricate and interesting. The service is always great. They only open on weekends (WHY?!)

If you're in the area and need a caffeine fix, you gotta try here!

review_id: A very nice place to stop for a coffee and a treat. We enjoyed several types of the croissants and coffee of course. The guy was very friendly

review_id: A very kind man who was bartending at The Parkdale Hall Candlelight concert made me a tea from this coffee shop even though it was closed. Thank you for your kindness! I will be back to visit :-)
review_text: A very kind man who was bartending at The Parkdale Hall Candlelight concert made me a tea from this coffee shop even though it was closed. Thank you for your kindness! I will be back to visit :-)

review_id: Fantastic little cafe run by a father son duo, that genuinely care about their customers, and the quality of food and drink they offer. Cleanliness is 10/10, their work stations are SPOTLESS, its incredible! All of the meat options they offer (not including deli) are prepped each morning, and taste fresh, and high quality. These are not the pressed, processed meats you find at Tim Hortons. Their level of detail and care is unmatched. I have literally watched the gentleman freshly chop whole leaves of lettuce, being careful to remove the ends, and wilted bits before adding to a salad. It's so wonderful to see an establishment put in the care and effort into the small things, and it is the biggest reason why I come back. All of this is just enhanced by the fact that each time you enter the space, your face is remembered and you are treated like a friend. Keep doing what you do Bold Brew, it is so appreciated!!!

review_id: My Go-to breakfast and lunch spot in Toronto. The owners are super friendly, the food is delicious and fresh, and the coffee is perfect! Love everything about this shop!
review_text: My Go-to breakfast and lunch spot in Toronto. The owners are super friendly, the food is delicious and fresh, and the coffee is perfect! Love everything about this shop!

review_id:
I was excited to work in Liberty Village and try a different restaurant every day, but once I had their daily soup, I have not changed my routine, everyday I come in, get greeted like close neighbors, have a sandwich, a coffee and their soup of the day. Great, real fresh food, ask the owner (his name is Ash) about any item on the menu and you can see he is passionate about making great food.

If you are just getting a coffee, get a croissant too, the smell makes my coworkers jealous!

review_id:
Quality of drinks is far better here than some other locations. I order fraps almost exclusively and have received a cup of blended ice with a bit of coffee many times before, but never from here. The morning staff are amazing and I am always impressed with the level of service they provide.

There is no option to place a mobile order, but the wait times are not unreasonable.

review_id:
Got my usual Iced Brown Sugar Oat Shaken Espresso. It seemed like the drink wasn't even shaken. Clear separation of coffee on the bottom, my first few sips was just milk.  Tried to shake my drink around but had to go back and get a stopper to stir it around and still just tasted milky and no coffee.

They also don't let you redeem Starbucks rewards offers here.

review_id: Cute local coffee shop in Parkdale. Has a few tables and outdoor red benches for a hot day. Rustic decor with open brick. Old hard cover books and coffee paraphernalia  decorates the bookshelves. Two leaves and a bud is the tea brand. Organic coffee beans. Had a latte which was smooth, perhaps I would ask for more espresso shots next time because I like my latte strong. Also had a orange pecan cookie which was delicious, sweet but not too sweet and had the texture of a shortbread cookie. Staff were very friendly and even offered to replace a spilled coffee for minimal cost. Very reasonable priced. Latte for under $5! Overall: Nice place to try locally with a homey feel. Probably really 4.5*

review_id: My cappuccino was terrible (was more like a latte in a large cup) and found the server to be rude. Space is far from cozy (would say kinda danky ) not a great place to work from. If you get the green tea latte I'd reco getting half or no sweetener. Only has oat milk and not the barista kind, aka not friendly for those that are dairy free. Won't be making a trip back any time soon.

review_id:
The Abbott is a cute little coffee shop tucked away in Parkdale.
Nestled on King Street and Adjacent to Spencer Avenue, The Abbott is a convenient coffee shop situated for the community.
I keep on coming back to the Abbott whenever I am in the area , and it never fails to disappoint.
I really enjoyed the coffee here and they have a great selection of baked goods as well.
review_text:
The Abbott is a cute little coffee shop tucked away in Parkdale.
Nestled on King Street and Adjacent to Spencer Avenue, The Abbott is a convenient coffee shop situated for the community.
I keep on coming back to the Abbott whenever I am in the area , and it never fails to disappoint.
I really enjoyed the coffee here and they have a great selection of baked goods as well.

review_id: Very slow service no matter how many people are behind the counter. I've never had any food here, so I can't speak to that. Coffee is pretty good. A bit acidic for my preference.
review_text: Very slow service no matter how many people are behind the counter. I've never had any food here, so I can't speak to that. Coffee is pretty good. A bit acidic for my preference.

review_id: Espresso was ok, a little burnt unfortunately. Staff person was nice, however the benches out front are pretty wobbly and the bathroom looks like it needs a good scrub and a coat of paint.
